results.title: New insights into the role of mitochondrial metabolic dysregulation and immune infiltration in septic cardiomyopathy by integrated bioinformatics analysis and experimental validation
results.text_hl: The distribution of @DISEASE_Myopathy_with_Giant_Abnormal_Mitochondria @DISEASE_MESH:C564971 @@@mitochondria@@@/@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@-related pathways varied across subgroups among control and @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@SCM@@@ individuals. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was predicted to be the most promising drug with the highest combined score.

results.title: Autophagy-dependent and -independent modulation of oxidative and organellar stress in the diabetic heart by glucose-lowering drugs
results.text_hl: In contrast, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@SGLT2@@@ inhibitors activate @GENE_SIRT1 @GENE_23411 @@@SIRT1@@@ and/or @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ and promote autophagic flux to varying degrees in cardiomyocytes, which may explain their benefits in experimental @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@.

results.title: Metformin Attenuates Postinfarction Myocardial Fibrosis and Inflammation in Mice
results.text_hl: Taken together, these results open new perspectives for the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a drug that counteracts adverse @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial@@@ fibroticand @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ remodeling after @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@MI@@@.

results.title: Upregulation of Wilms' Tumor 1 in epicardial cells increases cardiac fibrosis in dystrophic mice.
results.text_hl: Our study demonstrates that upregulation of @GENE_WT1 @GENE_22431 @@@Wt1@@@ in epicardial cells contributes to @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ in @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@dystrophic hearts@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-mediated inhibition of @GENE_NFKB1 @GENE_18033 @@@NF-kappaB@@@ can ameliorate the pathology, and thus showing clinical potential for @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@dystrophic cardiomyopathy@@@.
